nodes.title: 4 - ðŸŽ­ Character Voices
widgets_values: And contrary to using the whole image as suggested by the official Comfy UI workflow, this will preserve your image quality against VAE degradation.

# ðŸ›¡ï¸ ChatterBox Crash Protection System

ChatterBox has a bug where text shorter than ~21 characters causes CUDA tensor errors that can crash ComfyUI. The crash protection system automatically pads short text segments to prevent these crashes.

## How It Works

- **Template**: `"hmm ,, {seg} hmm ,,"` (default)
- **Trigger**: Activates when text segments are too short
- **Process**: Replaces `{seg}` with original text: `"hello"` â†’ `"hmm ,, hello hmm ,,"`

## Configuration

Set the crash protection template on the **ChatterBox Engine** node:

- **Default**: `"hmm ,, {seg} hmm ,,"`
- **Custom**: `"Well, {seg}"`, `"...ummmmm {seg}"`, `"{seg}... yes... {seg}"`
- **Disable**: Leave empty string `""`

# ðŸŽ­  **Voice Tips**

1- For **Chatterbox** and **Higgs 2**, you can connect any audio from a **Load Audio Core** node directly for **zero-shot voice cloning**
 
2- or use the **ðŸŽ­ Character Voices** feature to load a narrator from your `Voices` folder.

3- **F5-TTS** â—needsâ— a reference text for the narrator. For **Higgs 2** it is optional. ALL voices on the dropdown from the node 'ðŸŽ­ Character Voices' necessary have a reference text.

4- You can make your own manual voice with reference by connecting a voice (f5 should not exceed 10s) and writting the reference text yourself.
 

ðŸŽ­ **Character Voices** can also be connected to the **Voice Changer** for dynamic voice cloning in Voice Changer when using Chatterbox Engine.

# **FROM v4 and up!**

Unified nodes:
- ðŸŽ¤ **TTS Text**: Direct text-to-speech module  
- ðŸ”„ **Voice Changer**: Voice transformation  
- ðŸ“º **TTS SRT**: Subtitle-compatible TTS output  

These nodes are now **engine-agnostic**, meaning you can plug in **Chatterbox**, **F5**, **Higgs 2** or future engines seamlessly.

**ðŸ“º TTS SRT** supports **Higgs 2**, **Chatterbox** and **F5**, giving you more versatility in voice manipulation.

## Experiment connecting the F5 Engine

# F5 TTS

## Settings:

- F5 is an 'older' mode but can also be high quality. It has multiple languages support. It can be very sensitive with its settings, so experiment as well.
- F5TTS_v1_Base is newer, ans supposedly better. 
- F5TTS_Base and F5TTS_v1_Base needs different temperature and CFG settings. In my experimentations, v1 seams more erratic.

## Obs.
### - F5 is very fast and light weighted compared to ChatterBox or Higgs 2
### - Chatterbox has an `exaggeration` slider, F5 does not. 
### - F5 has native speed control. ChatterBox does not.
### - You should watch out for any exclamation point "!"

# Higgs Audio 2 TTS

## Settings:

- Higgs 2 can be very high quality, but it is very sensitive with its settings, so experiment
- The default settings work well for most prompts in my testings.

## Native Multi-Speaker-Mode:

I actually recommend my custom [Chatacter Name] system. But you can try the Native multi-speaker capabilities of the model. For that:
- Connect a optional second narrator on the 
opt_second_narrator input
- Change the dropdown menu to (Conversation)
- Check out the tooltips (mouse hoover) to see how you should input your text. It needs specific tags: [SPEAKER0] and [SPEAKER1]

# Chatterbox TTS

## Settings:

- The default settings (`exaggeration=0.5`, `cfg_weight=0.5`) work well for most prompts.
- If the reference speaker has a fast speaking style, lowering `cfg_weight` to around `0.3` can improve pacing.

## Expressive or Dramatic Speech:

- Try lower `cfg_weight` values (e.g. ~`0.3`) and increase `exaggeration` to around `0.7` or higher.
- Higher `exaggeration` tends to speed up speech; reducing `cfg_weight` helps compensate with slower, more deliberate pacing.

00:00:01,000 --> 00:00:06,500
Hello I'm Tony the narrator! Here is Alice:
[En:Alice] Hey Tony! ,,, Bob... can you speak German for us?

2
00:00:05,850 --> 00:00:08,500
[German:Bob] Ja natÃ¼rlich! Ich spreche gerne Deutsch.

3
00:00:08,500 --> 00:00:18,000
[USA:Alice] Wow that's cool, you are the man Bob! [Bob] Thanks! I know I'm amazing! [pause:500ms] 
Hum, he is a showman... I can do that too! 

4
00:00:16,100 --> 00:00:20,000
[En:Alice] And what about Norwegian, can you speak that?

5
00:00:17,100 --> 00:00:21,500
[Norwegian:Bob] Hei Alice an Tony! Jeg snakker norsk ogsÃ¥!

6
00:00:21,000 --> 00:00:22,500
[En:Alice] You're talking over me Bob, calm down!

7
00:00:22,100 --> 00:00:24,500
[En:Bob] Sorry Alice, I got too excited about languages.

8
00:00:24,500 --> 00:00:29,500
The narrator can switch languages too.
[German:] Ich kann auch Deutsch sprechen, natÃ¼rlich!

9
00:00:29,500 --> 00:00:36,500
[pause:1500ms] And that's ChatterBox with SRT multilingual character conversations and overlaps!!

Hello! This is unified TTS with character switching support.
[Alice] Hi there! I'm Alice speaking with the selected TTS engine.
[Bob] And I'm Bob! This works with any TTS engine.
Back to the main narrator voice for the conclusion.

2

with no stretching at all at the SRT start times,

3

padding any gaps with silence.

4
00:00:14,200 --> 00:00:20,000

1
00:00:00,000 --> 00:00:03,500
Welcome to ComfyUI ChatterBox Voice, the ultimate text-to-speech solution.

2
00:00:03,500 --> 00:00:07,000
This project integrates F5-TTS technology with ComfyUI workflows.

3
00:00:07,000 --> 00:00:10,500
F5-TTS: A Fairytaler that Fakes Fluent and Faithful Speech with Flow Matching.

4
00:00:10,500 --> 00:00:14,000
It provides high-quality voice cloning with reference audio samples.

5
00:00:14,000 --> 00:00:17,500
Our implementation supports multiple languages including English and German.

6
00:00:17,500 --> 00:00:21,000
The Audio Wave Analyzer provides interactive waveform visualization.

7
00:00:21,000 --> 00:00:24,500
You can extract precise timing information for speech editing workflows.

8
00:00:24,500 --> 00:00:28,000
This project extends the original ChatterBox nodes by ShmuelRonen.

9
00:00:28,000 --> 00:00:31,500
We've added SRT subtitle processing with intelligent timing modes.

10
00:00:31,500 --> 00:00:35,000
The smart natural timing prevents overlaps and ensures natural flow.

11
00:00:35,000 --> 00:00:38,500
Segment-level caching only regenerates modified parts for efficiency.

12
00:00:38,500 --> 00:00:42,000
F5-TTS models support Spanish, French, and Japanese languages too.

13
00:00:42,000 --> 00:00:45,500
Voice references can be managed easily with our dedicated folder system.

14
00:00:45,500 --> 00:00:49,000
Simply place your WAV files with matching transcription text files.

15
00:00:49,000 --> 00:00:52,500
The system auto-detects voice references from dropdown selections.

16
00:00:52,500 --> 00:00:56,000
Enhanced chunking breaks long texts into manageable sentence segments.

17
00:00:56,000 --> 00:00:59,500
Multiple combination methods include crossfade and silence padding.

18
00:00:59,500 --> 00:01:03,000
ComfyUI workflows can be downloaded and dragged directly into the interface.

19
00:01:03,000 --> 00:01:06,500
The Audio Wave Analyzer workflow enables precise F5-TTS speech editing.

20
00:01:06,500 --> 00:01:10,000
This comprehensive solution brings professional TTS capabilities to ComfyUI.

21
00:01:10,000 --> 00:01:13,500
Voice conversion transforms one speaker's voice into another's style.

22
00:01:13,500 --> 00:01:17,000
Smart silence detection captures voice input with configurable thresholds.

23
00:01:17,000 --> 00:01:20,500
Temperature and CFG settings control voice variation and guidance strength.

24
00:01:20,500 --> 00:01:24,000
The project maintains backward compatibility with existing workflows.

25
00:01:24,000 --> 00:01:27,500
Installation is straightforward with pip requirements and model downloads.

26
00:01:27,500 --> 00:01:31,000
Thank you for exploring ComfyUI ChatterBox Voice with F5-TTS integration.

1
00:00:00,000 --> 00:00:06,000
Smart natural... intelligently adjusts timings [pause:1]

2
00:00:06,000 --> 00:00:11,200
within the timing tolerance setting,

3
00:00:11,200 --> 00:00:15,800
prioritizing natural audio [wait:100ms] and shifting later segments.

4
00:00:15,800 --> 00:00:21,500
It applies stretch or shrink within the limits

5
00:00:21,500 --> 00:00:26,000
set by the minimum [stop:1s] and maximum stretch ratio.

6
00:00:26,000 --> 00:00:31,000
[female_01] This would be the perfect, most natural option...

7
00:00:31,000 --> 00:00:35,000
[Bob] if stretching didnâ€™t hurt the audio quality so much...

8
00:00:35,000 --> 00:00:40,000
Oh! But it's not a problem anymore [Narrator] now that we are using FFmpeg!!

9
00:00:40,000 --> 00:00:48,000
Try changing limiting the max stretch ratio option to 1.0 to make it more natural!

1
00:00:01,000 --> 00:00:04,000
Hello! This is unified SRT TTS with character switching.

2
00:00:04,500 --> 00:00:09,500
[Alice] Hi there! I'm Alice speaking with precise timing.

3
00:00:10,000 --> 00:00:14,000
[Bob] And I'm Bob! The audio matches these exact SRT timings.
